question: Which among the following country officers get training from the Indian Military Training Team (IMTRAT)?
explanation: The Indian Military Training Team, established in 1961-62. It is a training mission of the Indian Army in Bhutan. IMTRAT is responsible for the training of the personnel of the Royal Bhutan Army and the Royal Bodyguard of Bhutan. It is the oldest training team sent outside India to a friendly foreign nation.
